column3: “A pleasant sativa suitable for novice and experienced patients alike. Django provides the user with an intense uplifted and euphoric sensation, however due to the strains lower THC content experienced users may need a higher dosage to achieve the desired effects. The taste  hits the pallet with a bold floral flavour followed by sweet, earthy undertones. Smell is identical to taste, very floral yet sweet and earthy. O...”
“this is a mellow strain easy to smoke. careful on uptake. if not cured correctly can be harsh. not a couch  lock. very uplifting with  nice  cerebral  high.”
“Excellent green, cures mustle spasms and keeps you uplifted.”
“This smoke is just as bad ass as the movie..”

“A really pleasant strain for if you want to go out and be active while lifting your moods- going for a hike on this strain makes it amazing- this truly is what epitomizes sativas. Strong head rush you feel great and don't lose any energy whatsoever.”
“This strain, wasn't bad, but I wouldn't say its a 8" rating.  It gives a good  easy high if your a light smoker.  I personally am not
column4: so I  only tend to buy it when I'm low on cash and just want something to smoke
column5: with not a lot of expectations. Personally I would classify it as snicklefritz to those who are heavy smokers such as me.”"

column3: “Soooo, I've kinda strayed away from the sativas lately. I've been getting headaches w certain strains, or a bit of anxiety from them, so I kinda fell back on the old faithful indicas or an Indica dominant hybrid. But I still really missed that energetic, citrusy punch in the face in the morning so I decided to order another sativa I had heard of through a pal, Django. AWESOME strain! Beautiful tight, dense buds w a b...”
“What a wonderful sativa high. Feels like some amber ice or the clear. Great fucking shatter  comes when you unchain Django. Haha see what i did there”
